Informations complémentaires

Même à 500, on prend le temps de partager !

Lors des fameux “Happy Meetings” parisiens suivis en visio par toutes les équipes dans le monde pour partager l’actualité du groupe
En se glissant - temporairement - dans la peau de ses collègues avec les "Vis ma vie"
Avec son “Jedi Master” (sorte de parrain) attribué aux nouvelles recrues
Et bien sûr, lors des apéros, des cours de yoga, des meetups techniques, des barbecues, de la MMCup (un long week-end d’activités au soleil)... et bien plus encore !

Avec Netatmo il est question de maison intelligente ! Notre mission est d’imaginer pour vous des produits pour une maison plus sûre et plus confortable.
Gérez votre chauffage et vos économies d’énergie à partir de notre Thermostat connecté - détectez les intrus grâce à nos caméras intégrant l'intelligence artificielle et le traitement de l'image - accédez au plus vaste réseau de stations météorologiques personnelles. Nous collaborons avec des partenaires tels que Groupe Muller, Velux et Legrand pour partager avec eux notre expertise produit et travailler ensemble pour révolutionner votre maison.
Nous sommes une équipe internationale de 250 personnes engagées et passionnées, plus de 20 nationalités représentées dans nos équipes, localisées en grande majorité sous le même toit en région parisienne. Ayant gagné de nombreux prix au CES, Netatmo recherche des nouveaux talents pour accompagner son développement.
Si vous voulez faire partie de la révolution Smart Home, n’attendez plus pour candidater !
Description du poste
Au sein de la team Growth Engineering, vous serez sous la responsabilité du data analyst & architect, et contribuerez à structurer les briques d’ETL (Azure Cloud) et visualisation (Power BI) de notre datamart.
Vos trois enjeux principaux sont :
Création/Optimisation de Data Visualisation
Définition du cahier des charges des projets à venir & gestion du feedback des utilisateurs finaux
Datamining et structuration de scripts SQL pour trouver de nouveaux insights
Data Visualisation
Mettre en place des reports précis et impactants sous Power BI à destination de nos utilisateurs finaux
Utiliser des notions avancées de data viz telles que les hiérarchies & paramètres
Décliner notre reporting sur notre app mobile de dashboarding
Cahier des charges & Feedback
Être à l’écoute des besoins de nos différentes teams (nos sources de données sont très variées : App usage, ventes, parcours marketing…)
Transformer ces besoins en cahier des charges avec le reste de l’équipe Growth Engineering pour aboutir à des projets concrets
Accompagner les utilisateurs finaux dans le maniement des outils créés
Implémenter les améliorations et retours remontés

Datamining et structuration de scripts SQL
Comprendre et réussir à parcourir les tables créées
Aider à définir de nouveaux KPIs en sourçant des insights via des croisements de tables
Veille sur les performances de nos requêtes
Veille sur la data quality & legal compliance
Qualifications
Vous préparez une formation Bac +5 de type école d’ingénieur ou école de commerce avec une spécialisation dans un des domaines suivants : computer science, business intelligence, statistiques, big data…
Vous maîtrisez déjà un des outils majeurs de Data Visualisation (Tableau, QlikView, Power BI…)
Vous avez des connaissances en SQL, et vous vous intéressez à Unix
Vous êtes à l’aise avec la compréhension de logiques métiers spécifiques (Sales, Marketing, R&D) pour comprendre et répondre aux besoins en insights des utilisateurs finaux
Excellent relationnel
Bon anglais oral & écrit
Informations complémentaires
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Dans notre entreprise en pleine croissance et forte d’une vision internationale, vous pourrez (enfin ! pour certains) exprimer vos qualités d’entrepreneur, travailler en équipe pour réussir ensemble, partager vos idées innovantes, et surtout être écouté.
Au-delà d’un package attractif, en tant que collaborateur, vous pouvez :
découvrir lors de nos Welcome Days notre histoire et vision et comprendre les métiers de chacun.
participer à nos afterworks, petit-déj anniversaires, Barbecue du Boss, International Lunchs, Christmas Party et bien d’autres évènements.
recevoir un exemplaire gratuit de chaque produit Netatmo car le meilleur ambassadeur de la marque, c’est vous !
participer à des meetups et conférences technologiques ou business pour suivre toutes les actualités dans votre domaine d’expertise.
devenir Net@fit en rejoignant nos cours de sports (Pilates, Yoga, Boxe, Crossfit, …), équipes de football, running ou ping-pong… Et qui dit sport, dit aussi alimentation saine : profiter des fruits gratuits déposés chaque matin dans notre espace convivial où se rejoignent les équipes.
exprimer vos talents de mélomane dans nos ateliers de musique Net@sound.

ABOUT SC JOHNSON

SC Johnson, a family company for the last 130 years, is one of the world’s leading makers of household brands. The company has operations in more than 70 countries and sells products in virtually every country around the world. We employ approximately 13,000 people globally and generate $10 billion in sales. SCJ’s product portfolio includes global brands such as Pledge®, Duck®, Mr. Muscle®, Windex®, Scrubbing Bubbles®, Glade®, Raid®, OFF!®, Baygon® and Ziploc®.

At the same time, we’ve established a generations-long legacy of environmental responsibility, community leadership and providing great places to work. We do this because we want to do what’s right for our business today, and also what’s right for people and the planet tomorrow.

ROLE SUMMARY

Reporting to the Supply Planning Associate Manager (based in the Planning Hub located in Italy), this is an exciting opportunity for Supply Chain professionals who have a desire to develop their career in a Supply Planning role in cross functional and regional teams.

In this role, by interacting with regional and local Commercial and Supply Chain functions, you will be in charge of the end to end planning activities for promotional and everyday Finished Goods produced offline at repackers for the Western Cluster (France, Spain and Portugal).

You will define Finished Goods' (mainly promotional) replenishment plans to be shared and agreed with third parties repackers, in order to grant target service and inventory levels. You will monitor performances and course correct when needed, communicating plans with relevant stakeholders and will manage product changes related to own managed portfolio of SKUs.

If you are passionate about Supply Chain and looking for exciting challenges in a multinational environment, we’d like to hear from you!

Based in Paris - France, we can offer you a competitive salary and group profit share. We care about the well-being of our people and other benefits include health insurance, pension plan, employee saving schemes, and many other benefits.
Job Details:
RESPONSIBILITIES
Accountable for maintenance of Master Data records.
Accountable for managing the relationship with third party manufacturers for what concerns:
Issuing production/shipping plans as per MPS recommendation
Monitoring/improving service levels
Monitoring/improving manufacturer´s resource capacity versus SCJ requirements
Monitoring/improving customer service levels to SCJ Subsidiaries
Monitoring/reducing inventories at SCJ Subsidiaries
Align supply plan with the company inventory targets i.e. DOI, Remnant and Obsolete Inventories.
Manage product changes representing supply planning in project teams.
Support in managing the Sales & Operation Planning process, reconciling SCJ demand with third party contract manufactures production capabilities.
Support resolution of tactical issues with components and raw material suppliers.

DESIRED SKILL REQUIREMENTS/COMPETENCIES / EXPERIENCE:
Education: BS Degree in Economics/Engineering/Supply Chain Management/Business.
Internship experience in Planning or in other Supply Chain Functions within FMCG environment.
Fluent in speaking, writing, and reading French and English. An additional language is considered a plus.
Supply Planning skills and ability to use ERP systems (SAP modules ECC, APO, PLM) are considered a plus.
Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills, ability to interact with key stakeholders from various organizational levels and from different functions.
Strong team player attitude.
Strong customer orientation and ability to deal with complexity and ambiguity.

L’équipe Produit & Expérience est composée des pôles Product Owners, UX /UI Designers et SEO.
Le Data Analyste est présent en support de ces 3 pôles afin d’évaluer la performance des différents projets aussi bien au niveau du comportement des utilisateurs (interactions avec les différentes fonctionnalités du site) qu’au niveau du business (Augmentation des visites, conversion d’achat & de vente).
En tant que stagiaire Web Data Analyst, vos missions seront notamment les suivantes :
1.Vous accompagnez nos équipes dans l’utilisation de la donnée et l’analyse des projets :
L’expert(e) des données ? C’est VOUS. Vous croisez les données issues de différents outils (BI, site analytics, rapports de prestataires externes, sur lesquels nous vous formerons), afin de démontrer la pertinence des nouveaux projets ;
Les équipes UX et Produit ne peuvent se passer de vos fabuleux talents : vous mesurez la performance de leurs actions grâce à des AB Test et faîtes parler les mystérieux chiffres que vous trouvez ;
Grâce à vos analyses, vous participez à l’amélioration continue de nos parcours et interfaces utilisateurs et donnez aux UX Designers et Product Owners des recommandations qui rendront la vie plus belle à nos client(e)s ;
Vous retrouvez régulièrement les Business Owners autours d’un bon café pour parler de la conception des projets, et participez aux réunions de suivi.
2.Les données sont au cœur de votre attention, et vous êtes garant(e) de leur qualité:
Vous réalisez des rapports et des tableaux de bord ultra clairs sur les indicateurs clefs de performances (visites, taux de conversion, etc..) qui serviront à l’analyse globale des performances ;
Vous gardez de plus à l’œil les outils qui sont configurés sur notre site, et checkez que les mises à jour ne dérèglent pas l’arrivée des données.
Votre Profil
Etudiant(e) en école de commerce, d’ingénieur ou équivalent universitaire, vous parlez couramment l’internet et avez vos sites chouchous (on ne vous en voudra pas si vous n’êtes pas encore client chez nous mais on compte bien vous y initier !)
Vous aimez les chiffres, vous savez les comprendre et les expliquer aux autres équipes. Vous faîtes un binôme de choc avec Excel et décortiquez les tableaux pour modéliser les données et faire des analyses dignes de votre ancien prof de maths.
Quand vous n’êtes pas plongé(e) dans vos chiffres, vous aimez bavarder avec les autres équipes.
Et si vous connaissez quelques outils de mesure web analytics (At Internet, Google Analytics..) c’est le pompon !
Conditions :
Début de stage : Ce stage est à pourvoir pour juillet 2019
gratification : 800€ – 1 000€ (selon le niveau d’études)
durée : 6 mois, temps plein
Votre candidature sera composée d’un CV et d’une lettre de motivation.

Who we are
At Criteo, we are building the advertising platform of choice for the open Internet, an ecosystem that favors neutrality, transparency and inclusiveness. With more than 1.4 billion active shoppers and $600 billion in annual commerce sales, we deliver performance at scale. Founded in a Paris start-up incubator, Criteo now carries out our entrepreneurial spirit across 30+ global offices. Do you want to have an impact on more than half of the world’s internet users? Join us and be part of something big.

Overview
Our Data Analytics team has grown very large quickly, and our business has altogether grown in complexity. While maintaining autonomy of data analysts, we built a company-wide coordination team that actively manages analytical expertise, defines and enforces usage policies as well as drives alignment across teams.
The mission our Global Analytics Enablement team is simple: empower Criteo Analysts.

What you will your objectives:

Tools available for leveraging Criteo data assets change quickly. There are data visualization tools, but also tools made internally for data creation. There are also SQL clients or scripting needs, think Jupyter notebooks here. Drive the evolution of our tool stack thanks to:

Becoming a go-to person for R&D SRE stakeholders on any Analytics related topics
Assessing tooling needs of the Analytics community
Helping R&D prioritize features for development
Rolling out (documentation, training, communication)

More and more analytics at Criteo are comfortable to developed small python apps, allowing the end user to get direct interactive access to insights and action triggering. R&D has built a centralize scalable hosting solution to host these apps. We need you to master our app hosting solution and support the Analytics Community on it. This includes:

Being able to create, maintain and debug python apps hosted on the Criteo Stack
Supporting AX developers work on apps
Understanding and leverage the R&D stack we rely on

250 Analysts at Criteo, in more than 20 countries, more and more python enabled. So many tools improving internal efficiency have been created, the value Criteo has gotten out of it is tremendous! These new tools coded by analysts enabled more automation and focus on more added value tasks. We, as the Global Team get involved to better coordinate these efforts. Enable technical coordination projects:

Identify needs of such projects
Ensure project management is properly done (and do it yourself if needed)
Technical Migrations
Examples: setting up a virtual team for a new tool creation, coordinating a platform
Any analyst at Criteo has access to one of biggest data warehouse of the world. Our team is the organizational link between R&D teams in charge of that data and the analytics community who uses it. We are here when a data issue is brought up by an AX, we're also here when new data is needed for the AX. Last but not least, for about a year, the 250 Criteo Analyst are now able to autonomously create their own data pipelines. We're in charge of running that self-service platform for the analysts. We need you to govern Analytics Data.

Support Analytics team on data related tickets and create documentation to reduce their numbers
Operate Dataflow and optimize low value add tasks
What do we expect?
You have 2-4 years’ experience in a BI focused role with technical (Tableau and Vertica ideally) and analytical components (BI consultant, BI analyst, BI developer, BI Product Owner/Manager…)
You are fluent in English
You are passionate about business intelligence, data visualization, and the power of analytics
You have good technical expertise: SQL, R, Python and other programming languages
You can demonstrate your end to end problem solving ability
You are able to present results to both technical and non-technical audiences
You are versatile, self-driven, detail-oriented and hands-on
You are a team player, loving to work for the betterment of a community.

As a global medical technology leader for more than 35 years, everyone here is working toward one goal – transforming lives by tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With innovative products, a collaborative culture and a deep passion for human life, a career with Boston Scientific is more than just a job. It’s personal.
About the role
Reporting to the Manager of Master Data Management and Business Solutions, the core objective of this role will be to actively support the processes and projects designed by the Master Data Manager. With strong business process acumen and data analysis skills, this role will provide insights to the team within the Data Governance framework and develop and propose strategies to exploit opportunities for improvement and partner with business stakeholders across multiple software platforms to implement.
Process excellence, data accuracy and quality are the three main objectives for the Master Data Management and Business Solutions team and as such this role will entail strong involvement in analyzing data, business activities and reporting tools, gathering the voice-of-customer from our business partners and executing the implementation of continuous improvement initiatives to ensure the effective and efficient achievement of business goals and objectives.
Key Responsibilities
Working within the Data Governance framework to contribute to accurate and consistent data maintenance across EMEA
Accumulate knowledge and be the key go-to subject matter expert on business process and the role of Master Data within those processes
Articulate the role of Master Data through various forums to audiences with differing levels of understanding and being adept in tailoring language for those audiences providing insights and guidance
Support Master Data Management and Business Solutions Team with Data Analysis and insights
Proactively gather voice-of-customer in terms of user experience issues (functionality / process / data), as well as related expectations after issue resolution (establish ‘as-is’ and ‘to-be’)
Investigate reasons for potential data issues and related alternative solutions
Analyse, synthesize and communicate data and issues into business language, meaningful and insightful messaging and plans
Regularly review and update Process and Procedural documentation
Work closely with cross functional teams to establish processes, procedures and defined roles and responsibilities for Master Data and Application Data Management.
Proactively identify opportunities for business process improvements which may not be envisioned by the business.
Knowledge of business practices, motivations and daily challenges faced by the business.
Project Management:
Manage processes, plans and projects assigned by senior management
Provide updates to senior management and all stakeholders through frequent communications of findings at regular intervals via reports and meetings
Develop recommendations to senior management and all stakeholders
Implement processes


Position Requirements
Experience:
University Degree in engineering or business
2-3 years’ experience in similar roles
Skills :
Analytical skills and structured thinking
Attention to detail
Design and write procedures and processes
Design, calculation and review of KPI dashboards
Problem solving & insight generation skills
Strong communication/stakeholder involvement skills with employees and BUs at all levels
Ability to work within a virtual team
Customer focus and ability to gather voice of customer
Change agent role and project implementation
Ability to execute repetitive activities if required
Time and task management
Plan – Do – Review mindset
Required Knowledge:
Advanced Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Word)
Working knowledge of SAP
SQL
Understanding of business process and of sales/marketing practices, OTC
Experience of building cross-functional relationships to gain commitment and influence stakeholders
Lean & Continuous Improvement methodologies
Fluent English
Interested?
Please apply online with your CV and supporting documents at: http://jobs.bostonscientific.com .

Job Segment: Database, Medical, Business Analyst, Manager, Engineer, Technology, Healthcare, Finance, Management, Engineering

Titre: INTELLIGENT COMPUTING BRANDING MANAGER M/F - MARKETING MANAGER
Descposte:
Missions et responsabilités
Responsibility:
The purpose of this role is to work in Huawei France Intelligent Computing Business team, deeply understanding the server industry and France customers, guiding market developing strategy in order to promote Huawei Intelligent computing solutions in the France enterprise market. The responsibilities include:
Responsibilities:
Support to define mid/long term brand strategies and achieves overall business goals for the brand; provide the input in establishing the strategic vision and work out yearly brand plan in collaboration with teams; develop multiple project milestones, brand plans, and contingency plans as needed based on budget, timing, and business need
Conducts analysis and periodical reviews of current performance, trends, market conditions, competitive activity, etc and recommend strategy for the marketing plan; promotional plan, and projects schedule process.
Contribute to development through France advertising and adapting with agreed strategy for existing and new products and solutions.
Develop and drive large-scale event strategy, campaign, and integrated marketing strategy; manage overall development and review process for key events or campaign; give suggestions on presence, sponsorship and participation levels for each event based on goals, objectives and budget , and set the vision and identify key objectives for key events.
Manage ongoing communications with core industry analysts, media, agencies and internal cross-functional marketing teams to ensure on-time and aligned execution;
Secteur d'activité
As part of the most strategic growth for Huawei in the future, Huawei’s Intelligent Computing Business is aiming at providing Intelligent Computing infrastructure solution and services to vertical market and enterprise customers. To establish the business strategy and services capability rapidly in France, which is the leading region in West-Europe, the Intelligent Computing Business Department is offering attractive career opportunities for talents who are willing to share Huawei’s vision.
Expérience, formation et compétences souhaitées
Requirements:
5+ years’ experience in marketing related role ,and prior experience working as a senior brand or marketing manager in a large global IT company, or prior experience as a professional for well-known advertising or marketing agency, is highly desirable
Successful track record in developing and managing the branding, preferably in the IT industry
High level understanding of best practice global marketing principles and branding strategy, and ability to provide strategic counsel
Extensive knowledge of the analyst relations, public relations, event marketing, digital marketing, advertising, etc.
Basic knowledge of IT products and solutions in terms of servers, storage, data center or cloud computing, virtualization, is preferable
Excellent oral and written communications skills, with the ability to develop compelling presentations and content
Strong project management and organization skills
Self-directed, independent thinker and a team player who can manage simultaneous projects and multitask across cross-functional teams in an extremely fast-paced setting.
Présentation de l’entreprise
About Huawei
At Huawei, we define human progress by innovations that enrich all humanity. We do not view connectivity as a privilege, but as a necessity. We believe that the impact of information and communications technology should be measured by how many people can benefit from it. We strive to engineer broadband technology to the highest standard, faster than ever, for everyone, everywhere.
Huawei is dedicated to innovating around the needs of our customers, continuously pushing the boundaries of ICT. We develop networks, solutions, and devices, serving one third of the world’s population in over 170 countries and regions. We are connecting systems, businesses, cities, societies and people around the globe; improving efficiencies, transforming industries and ultimately creating better experiences for everyone.
Join us, and together, we building a Better Connected World.
Job Type: Permanent
Experience:
Marketing Management: 5 years (Preferred)

About
ContentSquare is a fast-growing startup founded in 2012 with a mission to improve digital experiences across the board. To do this, we developed an innovative SaaS solution that helps brands understand how people are behaving on their digital platforms, and what they can do to optimize the customer journey.
We really value having a close relationship with all our clients, including Walmart, Tiffany & Co, l’Occitane, Kering, L’Oréal, and many more.
We have grown our team exponentially since 2012, and achieved a 150% YOY growth. In January 2018 we raised $42M to accelerate our international expansion with one goal: to become the leading Digital Experience Insights platform thanks to the infinite possibilities of AI.
We currently have offices in Paris, London, New York and Munich, and are expanding our footprint throughout North America and Asia.
It is an exciting time to join our truly international team, and help shape the strong values and ambitious vision that make ContentSquare a unique working environment with an enviable workplace culture.
Join the adventure, and together we can go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!






DISCOVER CONTENTSQUARE
What you will do
As a Marketing data Analyst in our Paris offices, you will be part of the Data Analyst team and dedicated to the global Marketing team, working with content writers, digital marketing managers, event managers, public resources and partners.
You’ll be responsible for providing data and insights from our database in order to support data centric content writing : reports, articles, infographics, events and partners content.
This data centric content is accountable for spreading a deeper and wider understanding of Contentsquare’s capabilities, methodology and expertise. You are ideally an excellent problem solver and insight provider that shines in data storytelling.
Responsibilities:
Explore, analyze and interpret data from BI tools and our database for event related content (black friday, cyber monday, sales impact, etc.), reports, partners articles, PR requests
Explore, analyze and interpret data from Contentsquare own analytical tool to support our website monitoring and digital strategy Guide and support the marketing team on data centric content ideation
Explore new and interesting ways to improve our methodology and process as the demand grow
Skills we are looking for
0-2 years experience in an analytical role in Technology/Consulting, Communication or Marketing team
You hold a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Communication, Big data, Statistics or another related UX field
You have strong analytical, written and verbal communication skills
You have a demonstrated interest in the Internet and technology
You are able to work in English
POSSIBILITY OF BECOMING PERMANENT & FULL-TIME POSITION

Job Description

En tant que Chef de projets chez Numberly, vous serez en charge :
En interne : de créer du lien entre les équipes business (Marketing, Media Traders, Legal) et les équipes techniques (Data Scientists, Data Engineers, DevOps, Data Analysts)
En externe : de traduire les besoins clients en solutions concrètes

Votre mission, si vous l’acceptez :
En interne
Vous participerez à l’implémentation de notre roadmap technique en :
Définissant le cahier des charges et le planning de vos différents projets
Suivant leur bonne livraison et leur qualité.
Assurant une veille technologique sur les outils du marché (Appnexus, Google, Facebook, etc.), et en vous adaptant aux nouvelles versions

Exemples de projets sur lesquels vous pourriez travailler :

Construisant des relations durables :
Production quotidienne (analyse de données, visualisation de données, implémentation de liens de tracking)
Calls et réunions régulières avec vos clients
Gestion des imprévus
Développant de nouveaux partenariats / connecteurs avec des plateformes techniques pour répondre aux besoins internes

Pour mener à bien ces missions, vous travaillerez avec des équipes expertes utilisant quotidiennement des technologies de pointe, de Python, MongoDB, Hadoop à ScyllaDB et Kafka. Vous aurez une vue d’ensemble de notre infrastructure entièrement internalisée, de la collecte à l’activation de la donnée.

Qualifications

Vous êtes en cours d'obtention d'un Bac+5 (université, école d’ingénieur, école de commerce)
Vous êtes ingénieux-se, patient-e et attentif-ve
Vous n’avez pas peur de saisir les opportunités d’améliorations
Vous êtes rigoureux-se et attentif-ve aux détails
Vous êtes curieux-se et apprenez vite
Vous êtes pragmatique et savez réfléchir rapidement
C’est un plus…
Vous avez un fort intérêt pour le web et le data marketing
Vous êtes déjà familier avec les acteurs du marché et leurs outils
Vous maitrisez SQL
Vous comprenez JavaScript, et/ou Python
Vous avez déjà une expérience en gestion de projet
Vous avez envie de prouver à vos collègues votre supériorité à Mario Kart

Contrat : stage ou alternance, possibilité d'embauche en fin de contrat.

Et bien sûr, lors des apéros, des cours de yoga, des meetups techniques, des barbecues, de la MMCup (un long week-end d’activités au soleil)... et bien plus encore !

Titre: POLICY ANALYST – GLOBAL PARTNERSHIP FOR EFFECTIVE DEVELOPMENT CO-OPERATION
Descposte:
Policy Analyst – Global Partnership for Effective Development Co-operation(Job Number: 12718)
Application Closing Date: 26-03-2019, 10:59:00 PM
The OECD is a global economic forum working with 36 member countries and more than 100 emerging and developing economies to make better policies for better lives. Our mission is to promote policies that will improve the economic and social well-being of people around the world. The Organisation provides a unique forum in which governments work together to share experiences on what drives economic, social and environmental change, seeking solutions to common problems.


The Development Co-operation Directorate (DCD) supports the Development Assistance Committee (DAC) to carry out its mandate to help increase financing for development and to improve the quality and effectiveness of development co-operation. Through inclusive partnerships for development, we help ensure better lives for people in the developing world by understanding development finance, strengthening aid delivery, improving development policy, and building partnerships for development. In this context, the Directorate also supports (jointly with the United Nations Development Programme) the operation of the Global Partnership for Effective Development Co-operation (Global Partnership), a multi-stakeholder platform to advance the effectiveness of development efforts by all actors, to deliver results that are long-lasting and contribute to the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).


One key contribution of the Global Partnership is its biennial global monitoring exercise. Led by close to 90 low- and middle-income countries receiving development co-operation, through multi-stakeholder processes involving bilateral and multilateral development partners, these efforts facilitate mutual review of the implementation of internationally-agreed commitments for more effective development co-operation. Results of national monitoring exercises are compiled in biennial DCD flagship reports on “Making Development Co-operation More Effective”.


DCD is looking for an experienced and dynamic Policy Analyst for the Global Partnership Support Team. The successful candidate will be responsible for further strengthening, implementing and leveraging the findings of the Global Partnership monitoring framework to support multi-stakeholder accountability for Busan commitments. S/he will lead a small team working on Global Partnership monitoring, and report directly to the Team Leader overseeing the Global Partnership Secretariat, under the overall guidance of the Head of Division.


Main Responsibilities
Policy Analysis
Manage and provide technical oversight for the Global Partnership’s monitoring work, including leadership over:
The technical refinement and further strengthening of the indicator framework, based on outreach and consultations across constituencies and experts;
The design and implementation of the country-led, multi-stakeholder process for data collection;
The analysis, drafting and preparation of the biennial, global flagship report;
The dissemination of results (including on UN-led follow-up and review processes) to generate subsequent evidence-based dialogue and action; including of the Third Monitoring Report, to be released in 2018.
Bring intellectual input to the broader work of the Global Partnership around monitoring approaches, accountability and development effectiveness, and the integration and alignment with other monitoring processes such as monitoring the implementation of effectiveness commitments in the context of the New Deal for Engagement in Fragile States.
Support OECD senior management to promote the Global Partnership and support OECD-DAC members’ delivery of their commitments under the Busan Partnership agreement.
Develop and identify synergies with the work of DAC subsidiary bodies and with other OECD directorates, international organisations, initiatives and platforms in areas of relevance to the Global Partnership’s substantive agenda.
Management and Co-ordination
Lead a small team and motivate staff to achieve efficient delivery of a work programme, taking responsibility for ensuring high quality, accurate and timely outputs.
Collaborate across the Joint Support Team, with UN colleagues, consultants and staff to ensure effective technical, advisory and operational support for a global multi-stakeholder monitoring process.
Lead collaboration and capacity building with over 120 countries (both providers and recipients of development co-operation), as well as with international organisations, civil society and private sector, to incentivise and advise their participation in Global Partnership monitoring efforts.
Communications, Liaison and Outreach
Assist with the development and implementation of outreach strategies that position the Global Partnership as a platform for the realisation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.
Collaborate with the publications and communications staff to ensure a high-quality and timely Progress Report and effective dissemination of its findings.
Engage with relevant technical and advisory bodies around the refining of the indicators, monitoring process and analysis of the data.
Represent the OECD at international meetings and conferences, as required.


Ideal Candidate Profile


Academic Background
An advanced university degree in economics, social sciences, international development or other relevant discipline.
Professional Background
At least three year’s experience but with a strong preference for a minimum of five years of relevant experience, including experience working in a bilateral or multilateral development organisation on development effectiveness and/or results-based management.
Excellent understanding of the overall development effectiveness and 2030 agendas, their political dynamics and implementation challenges, including at global and developing country levels.
Experience in leading and co-ordinating international multi-stakeholder consultative processes and in negotiating and navigating different views and consolidating agreed positions.
Solid project management experience, including in the drafting, editing, production and dissemination of policy papers, high-level publications and official reports.
Proven practical experience working with quantitative and qualitative data, monitoring frameworks and indicators, as well as refining this analysis into actionable policy recommendations. Specific expertise in indicator development in the areas of governance and/or organisational effectiveness, would be an asset.
Tools
Expert knowledge of statistical/econometric methods and proficiency in advanced statistical packages (i.e. Stata or R).
Advanced user in standard software applications, including Microsoft Office Excel and Powerpoint.
Intermediate knowledge of design and/or video editing software (e.g. Adobe Creative package) would be an asset.
Languages
Fluency in one of the two OECD official languages (English and French) and knowledge of the other, with a commitment to reach a good working level.
Knowledge of other languages would be an asset.
Core Competencies
For this role the following competences are of particular importance: Negotiation, Diplomatic sensitivity, Analytical thinking, Team work and team leadership, Achievement focus, Drafting skills.
Please refer to the level 3 indicators of the OECD Core Competencies.
Contract duration
18 month fixed term assignment, with possibility of renewal.
What the OECD offers (External only)


Depending on level of experience, monthly salary starts at either 5,974 EUR or 7,372 EUR, plus allowances based on eligibility, exempt of French income tax.


Please note that the appointment may be made at a lower grade based on the qualifications and professional experience of the selected applicant.


The OECD is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes the applications of all qualified candidates, irrespective of their racial or ethnic origin, opinions or beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, health or disabilities.
The OECD promotes an optimal use of resources in order to improve its efficiency and effectiveness. Staff members are encouraged to actively contribute to this goal.

License Management Analyst 3-Fin-190000LZ

Preferred Qualifications
As JPE consultant, he/she Leads LMS engagements remotely and on-site, leverages virtual teams through project management principles and collaboratively navigates the engagement from beginning to end. This is achieved by best matching which service offering suits the customer / partner engagement needs, obtaining an understanding of a customer/ partner’s IT environment and then recommending proper deployment of licenses. Through these activities, the Senior Consultant aims to transfer knowledge to our customers and partners throughout the engagement process to: Educate on Oracle licensing & business practices and their application. Equip with the skills, knowledge and/or tools needed to effectively manage Oracle licenses. Enable pro-active license control & management and the realization of the associated benefits. All services performed need the Senior License Consultant to have a thorough understanding of the customer’s/partner’s Oracle IT environment, including Oracle Applications, third party (or custom), and underlying system architecture. Some service types also entail the execution of system queries and installation of custom measurement scripts to obtain product usage data.

Maintains current and historical knowledge of LMS audit tools, processes, policies and technical specifications, and pursues continued understanding of corporate, organizational and licensing updates as it relates to LMS activities. Qualifies LMS engagements to determine most effective service category, scope and approach through data mining, interpretation of license agreements, analysis of transaction history and understanding customer / partner relationship to Oracle. Executes reviews through proactive management of cross-functional teams with timely accomplishment of review tasks and goals in order to gain a thorough understanding of their Oracle system environment and provide accurate licensing guidance. Actively builds internal and external relationships by establishing trust through accurate knowledge sharing, licensing guidance, and transparent engagement activities. Manages expectations of constituents involved in LMS engagement by working to resolve complex licensing issues leveraging Oracle’s contracts and business policies and presenting different options to achieve resolution. Progresses LMS engagements through active listening and persuasively articulating, both verbally and written, review status and direction. Ensures questions and concerns are given appropriate and timely consideration. Demonstrates balanced, impartial and timely judgment when making decision on the LMS engagement. Self-motivates to independently achieve personal and team LMS goals and objectives.
BA/BS degree in MIS, Business Administration, Finance, Legal or Accounting. 3-5 years experience in related field. Experience in Project Management Principles. Experience in working with C-level personnel. Ability to interpret and understand complex software licensing agreements and business practices and apply them to different scenarios. Ability to relate smaller concepts to the overall "big picture". Experience with executive-level presentations. Exemplary written and verbal communication skills. Travel is necessary.

The demand-planning organization of SC Johnson is responsible for the development of a demand forecast. Reporting to the Associate Manager Demand Planning, the primary role of the market demand planner will be to develop a demand forecast using data such as sales inputs on promotions and distribution, shipment history, competitor activities and marketing plans.

This position is a key driver in creating and managing the true consumer demand signals by which to align the rest of the supply chain and company resources. The role will also be the conduit in the cluster and country between the commercial teams and all of supply chain planning.
Job Details:
As the market demand planner, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining professional relationships with local and remote supply chain planning partners. You will also contribute to special projects and other supply chain and business strategy initiatives as well as facilitating the Pre-demand and Demand Reviews ensuring an efficient, effective, and reliable review driven by an unbiased, consensus process.
Key responsibilities of the role include:
Using and maintaining current demand planning systems to create the best forecast possible using established processes.
Collecting and analyzing past/future demand inputs (such as distribution gains/losses, price changes, new/discontinued products and promotion plans) from sales and marketing and calculate their impacts on demand.
Working with various cross functional partners on projects such as new product launches, discontinuations, and transitions to evaluate assumptions (pre and post launch) – new product forecast, pipeline fill, and cannibalization.
Ensuring demand forecast is shared with internal customers and supply chain partners
Influencing and collaborating with key partners in marketing, sales (field sales, corporate sales managers and directors), and finance to address input gaps as identified by forecast error/bias review & root cause analysis
Measuring, analyzing, and communicating key process metrics and monitor adherence to key performance indicators, while driving continuous improvement
POSITION REQUIREMENTS
Minimum of an undergraduate degree, preferably economics, supply chain management, engineering, or a related business field
Strong communication skills, with a proven ability drive action and influence decision making at all levels of the organization
Strong organizational skills, as well as the ability to perform under pressure and manage multiple priorities with competing demands
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proficiency in process improvement
Ability to work within high-performing teams in highly collaborative environments
Quantitative and qualitative data analysis, including business process metrics and measures linking to business KPIs
The following experience is considered essential:
Previous solid experience of Supply Chain or other similar Business experience
Experience using SAP
Hands-on experience in demand planning and simulation systems or tools
Experience working in the CPG industry
Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word and/or Access
In addition to a competitive package this is a great opportunity where there will be ample opportunity for career development and long-term international career progression within the wider business.

Marketing Data Analyst H/F

ING France fait partie du groupe néerlandais ING, l’une des principales institutions financières mondiales.
ING France, c’est la banque des particuliers (anciennement ING Direct) et la banque commerciale (ING Wholesale Banking).
ING favorise l'initiative personnelle et permet à chacun d'exprimer son potentiel :
vous aimez relever les défis ?
vous souhaitez les réaliser en équipe ?
vous avez cette longueur d’avance qui vous permettra d’atteindre vos objectifs ?
Rejoindre ING, c’est intégrer une grande « Tech company » dans un environnement Agile et innovant, qui met le client au centre de ses projets !
Pour participer à nos projets ambitieux, nous recherchons des profils audacieux et tournés vers le futur
Au sein d’une équipe de data analysts, vous produisez, analysez et présentez des données relatives à la connaissance client (profils, comportements, réponses aux sollicitations commerciales, etc.).
Vous contribuez plus spécifiquement à la mise en place, l’exécution et l’analyse des campagnes commerciales.
A ce titre, en contact direct avec les différentes équipes Retail d’ING, vous êtes force de recommandation pour optimiser le plan de sollicitations commerciales, contribuant ainsi à une expérience client plus personnalisée.
Vous participez également à la stratégie Data en collaboration avec vos pairs et les équipes IT.
Vos principales missions :
Construction et optimisation du plan de sollicitation
Participation à la définition des règles de sollicitation client et aux arbitrages entre les différentes campagnes commerciales. Pour cela, vous vous appuierez sur des analyses comportementales ainsi que sur la mesure de l’efficacité des campagnes passées
Exécution des campagnes commerciales
Ciblage marketing : avec les équipes CRM, vous participez à la définition du ciblage des campagnes (typologie de clients, canal, etc.). Vous vous appuyez pour cela sur votre connaissance de la base clients (volumétries, analyses de profil) et de l’historique des campagnes passées.
Paramétrage des campagnes commerciales : sur la base des specs finales, vous exécutez les campagnes push (e-mails, sms, etc.) et pull (bannières de l’espace client) via notre outil CRM.
Analyses de la performance commerciale et des comportements clients
Mesure systématique de l’efficacité de chaque campagne commerciale sur la base de KPI’s prédéfinis :
bénéfices business : ouvertures de produits, versements, etc.
bénéfices comportementaux : déclenchement d’usages vertueux (ex : domiciliations de salaires, utilisation de services ING, etc.)
Réalisation d’analyses ad hoc diverses permettant d’approfondir la connaissance client ou l’efficacité de certaines typologies de campagnes.

Profil
Niveau de formation : Bac +3 à Bac +5
Niveau d’expérience : expérience de 2 ans minimum, avec une affinité pour les problématiques marketing et CRM.
Compétences métier :
Aisance et gout pour l’analyse chiffrée
Connaissance indispensable de SAS
Anglais courant
La connaissance d’un outil CRM de gestion de campagne est un plus
Qualités personnelles : Curiosité, autonomie, force de proposition, capacité à communiquer, rigueur dans le suivi de l’opérationnel au quotidien.
Dynamique et doté d’un bon relationnel, vous êtes de nature ouverte et êtes à l’aise avec le travail en équipe.
Poste à pourvoir en CDI (Paris 12ème arrondissement).

Estates & Wines, the Moët Hennessy wine division, is a unique collection of prestigious wineries spread across 5 continents. Our vineyards are located on exceptional sites and are among the best terroirs of their appellation and each of our wineries have broken new ground - by pioneering new or forgotten regions; or through innovative & distinctive winemaking techniques.
Reporting to the E&W CFO, and working closely with the E&W Managing Director, the Business Analyst is responsible for delivering business performance analysis to help drive sales monitoring, optimize profitability of E&W brands/domains, enabling ultimately the strategic decision making on sales forecast and planning.
The Business Analyst is a strategic partner in direct liaisons with other E&W business functions: Business Development, Marketing & Estates Directors with the objective of providing a financial perspective to business operational challenges.

Business / Markets Sales performance analysis
Responsible for the consolidation & analysis of E&W brands sales datas on weekly, monthly and annual basis
Create tracking reports or dashboard to evaluate sales performance by brands, by category, by distribution channel
Provide analytical support on sales performance (e.g. Sales KPI, Productivity), identify risks & opportunities, highlight findings and make recommendations for improvement
Work closely with E&W BDDs/BDMs to support them in building and implementing strategies that drive commercial development and enhance E&W brands penetration through dashboards, simulations, etc.
Work closely with E&W BDDs/BDMs to analyze and review Pricing, Brand Positioning, Portfolio, Distribution Penetration and Channel Mix.
Support the preparation of financial budgets/forecasts
Support E&W BDDs/BDMs in their key markets by monitoring A&P expenses through market activations programs analysis
Others costs analysis

About
Splio is an omnichannel marketing platform that combines marketing automation and loyalty marketing. The platform enables marketers to unify their customer knowledge, orchestrate marketing campaigns and loyalty programs, both online and offline. Splio helps brands adapt to New Loyalty, with both points-based and relationship-based programs, to acquire, reactivate and engage their customers and boost their revenue.
More than 500 brands around the world use Splio every day, including The Kooples, La Grande Récré, Beauté Privée, Repetto, Le Slip Français, Longchamp....
Job Description
The Product Analyst intern is responsible for creating and maintaining Key Performance Indicators for the Splio platform: identification, specifications and implementation follow-up with development teams to release business-oriented dashboards. He or she will also support Product Managers in managing user groups for business-related topics and competitive benchmarks. This position reports to the Product Management Director and collaborates closely with Product managers and UX designers as well as the R&D team on global features linked to Splio’s product strategy.
Responsibilities:
Interview our customers to identify new business use case scenarios to improve our platform,
Identify new key performance indicators for our platform to analyze our customers behavior,
Write functional specifications for these new functionalities or make system changes to the Splio platform,
Support the implementation of change management activities by organizing UAT, authoring communications, creating training materials, and delivering training,
Analyze the market ecosystem and new technologies to identify relevant indicators that can improve the Splio platform experience,
Participate in Agile scrum teams.

Proactive and forward-thinking attitude and creative problem-solving ability
Excellent team player able to work with virtual and global cross functional teams
Experience with Google Analytics or any web analytics business tool
Experience with AGILE development methodology
Knowledge of web applications.

Location: Paris, France (75002)
Education Level: Master's Degree
Experience: > 1 year

Description de l'entreprise

Numberly aide ses clients à collecter, analyser et mettre à profit leurs données à travers tous les canaux marketing. Pour cela, nous sommes plus de 100 ingénieurs (un quart de Numberly) répartis en équipes à dimension humaine, où nous nous assurons que chacun développe une influence positive et puisse être autonome. Notre croissance soutenue nous pousse à constamment remettre en question nos choix techniques et organisationnels.

Avec sept bureaux dans le monde et des clients dans plus de cinquante pays, nos enjeux sont globaux.

De par notre large gamme de produits interconnectés, nos enjeux techniques sont très variés et souvent complexes. Nos missions quotidiennes consistent à traiter des milliers de requêtes par seconde, distribuées à travers le monde, opérer des bases de données de plusieurs pétaoctets (Big Data™), automatiser l’ensemble de notre infrastructure bare-metal, et construire les interfaces du marketing digital de demain.

Description du poste

En tant que Chef de projets chez Numberly, vous serez en charge :

En interne : de créer du lien entre les équipes business (Marketing, Media Traders, Legal) et les équipes techniques (Data Scientists, Data Engineers, DevOps, Data Analysts)
En externe : de traduire les besoins clients en solutions concrètes

Votre mission, si vous l’acceptez :
En interne

Vous participerez à l’implémentation de notre roadmap technique en :

Définissant le cahier des charges et le planning de vos différents projets

Suivant leur bonne livraison et leur qualité.

Assurant une veille technologique sur les outils du marché (Appnexus, Google, Facebook, etc.), et en vous adaptant aux nouvelles versions

Exemples de projets sur lesquels vous pourriez travailler :
Participer à la conception d’une interface de data visualization

Industrialiser un algorithme de NLP développé par nos data scientists

Implémenter un nouvel outil d’automatisation pour permettre l’accès des équipes business à la data

Construire un process d’alimentation de données en temps réel

En externe

Vous interagissez quotidiennement avec des clients et prospects en :

Répondant à leurs besoins via nos produits : DMP, Trading, CRM Programmatique

Construisant des relations durables :
Production quotidienne (analyse de données, visualisation de données, implémentation de liens de tracking)

Calls et réunions régulières avec vos clients

Gestion des imprévus

Développant de nouveaux partenariats / connecteurs avec des plateformes techniques pour répondre aux besoins internes

Pour mener à bien ces missions, vous travaillerez avec des équipes expertes utilisant quotidiennement des technologies de pointe, de Python, MongoDB, Hadoop à ScyllaDB et Kafka. Vous aurez une vue d’ensemble de notre infrastructure entièrement internalisée, de la collecte à l’activation de la donnée.

Profil recherché
Qualifications

Vous avez un Bac+5 en poche (université, école d’ingénieur, école de commerce)

Vous êtes ingénieux-se, patient-e et attentif-ve

Vous n’avez pas peur de saisir les opportunités d’améliorations

Vous êtes rigoureux-se et attentif-ve aux détails

Vous êtes curieux-se et apprenez vite

Vous êtes pragmatique et savez réfléchir rapidement

C’est un plus…

Vous avez un fort intérêt pour le web et le data marketing

Vous êtes déjà familier avec les acteurs du marché et leurs outils

Vous maitrisez SQL

Vous comprenez JavaScript, et/ou Python

Vous avez déjà une expérience en gestion de projet

Vous avez envie de prouver à vos collègues votre supériorité à Mario Kart

Informations complémentaires

Même à 500, on prend le temps de partager !

Lors des fameux “Happy Meetings” parisiens suivis en visio par toutes les équipes dans le monde pour partager l’actualité du groupe
En se glissant - temporairement - dans la peau de ses collègues avec les "Vis ma vie"
Avec son “Jedi Master” (sorte de parrain) attribué aux nouvelles recrues
Et bien sûr, lors des apéros, des cours de yoga, des meetups techniques, des barbecues, de la MMCup (un long week-end d’activités au soleil)... et bien plus encore !

Stuart is Europe’s leading on-demand logistics platform which connects businesses to a fleet of geolocalised couriers. Our platform allows businesses big and small in every industry to deliver to their customers with never-seen-before speed and efficiency.
In 2017 just 2 years from launch, Europe’s biggest logistics company GeoPost (Groupe La Poste) acquired Stuart so that it could join prestigious companies like DPD, Colissimo, SEUR & Chronopost and conquer urban logistics.
With an exciting blend of GeoPost Group expertise and a fun, agile start up culture, Stuart has expanded to more than 70 cities across the UK, France & Spain and continued the steep growth curve it’s become accustomed to.
What really makes Stuart tick though, is the 200+ people that work here every day to smash our goals. We are a free-thinking, enthusiastic bunch whether it’s sales or operations people, engineers or designers.
We’re passionate about looking at problems in fresh and innovative ways – every problem is just opportunity for a great solution. We love to invent new ways of doing things and come to work every day with smiles on our faces.
We are looking for a talented Business Analyst that helps us find sense on all the data our processes are generating. Your mission is to define, setup and implement the analytical tools and processes that can make Stuart a data driven company in all the departments.

What will you do?
Working within the Data Science team in an agile environment, the candidate will use his/her analytical skills in conjunction with other stakeholders in the company to bring insights about current business processes at Stuart.
Typical tasks include, but are not limited to:
Requirement gathering of analytical needs from different stakeholders within the company
Reporting and dashboard definitions that best communicate relevant Stuart KPIs to different business units
Documenting all the data sources and data life cycles contributing to Stuart’s data governance policies
Become the bridge between business units with analytical needs and the data engineers implementing the warehouse’s ETLs
The ideal profile would be a candidate eager to know all the business processes within the company and help deliver analytical insights across company. The candidate is knowledgeable on SQL and databases and on the right charts and graphs to transmit the message. The candidate knows how to explain complex stories backed with data, he/she is a superb storyteller.
Requirements
Who are you?
Fluent in English
Expert in SQL and how to write well performant queries when accessing Redshift databases
Proven experience with any of the main relevant BI tools (Periscope, Tableau, BusinessObjects, Pentaho, BIRT, SpagoBI, JasperSoft, etc…)
Experience in data modelling for databases
Ability to understand analytical needs and transform those into dashboards or reports
Extremely good communication skills both verbal and written
What is a plus?
Experience with Python for those analysis where SQL is not enough
Experience with ETL tools
Experience modelling data warehouses following the Star schema
Benefits
The icing on the cake?
Very competitive salary package
Monthly gym allowance to use in any gym or for any sport class - a healthy mind in a healthy body!
Annual company offsite – Barcelona this year!
Private health care
Work in an international, dynamic and passionate environment with a great company culture.
After reading all this just a few last but important words: We want you to take on a role you love and we want to offer you a place you’re proud and happy to come to everyday.
So if you feel like there is a fit, apply! Get in touch with us and hit that button. We wanna hear more about you!

Acteur leader de la transformation digitale des entreprises et du secteur public, Cegid améliore la performance de ses clients grâce à ses logiciels de gestion et services cloud.
Le groupe Cegid propose des solutions dans les domaines de la gestion financière, de la fiscalité et des ressources humaines, ainsi que des applications métiers destinées aux secteurs du retail, de l’industrie, du négoce, des services, de la profession comptable et du secteur public.
Portées par une politique d’innovation ambitieuse, les offres Cegid intègrent les nouveaux usages autour du cloud, de la mobilité, de l’analyse de données, de la dématérialisation, et des plateformes métiers collaboratives.
Groupe international de 2 500 collaborateurs répartis sur toute la France et dans 15 pays, Cegid compte plus de 120 000 clients et 430 000 utilisateurs, dont 150 000 en mode SaaS, et a réalisé un chiffre d’affaires de 332M€ en 2017.

Performance analyst
Acteur clé de l’entreprise, vous en maitriserez sa BI.
Vous aurez un report direct au DAF et un management fonctionnel avec les acteurs opérationnels du COMEX (DAF, Directeur des Opérations, Directeur F&B et DRH)
En tant que véritable business partner du COMEX, vous jouerez un rôle prépondérant dans le pilotage de la performance du Groupe.

Reporter pour créer de la valeur

Collecter, réconcilier, analyser, et restituer les données issues des différents outils / Produire des reportings à valeur ajoutée quotidien, hebdomadaires, et mensuels à l’attention du COMEX, des directeurs de restaurants, et Siège
Aider à la décision en véritable business partner en animant les équipes. Il doit avoir l’obsession de l’impact concret des analyses sur les opérations à travers des points de cadrages et l’identification de plans d’actions opérationnelles / Faire parler les chiffres, sortir des learnings « fact based » et « data driven », mettre en place des plans d’actions avec le COMEX, mesurer les plans d’actions dans le temps

Former les équipes siège et restaurants pour performer

Produire et animer les indicateurs clés de performance à suivre par métier / Ticket moyen, Topline, perfomance serveurs, Topline privatisations, marge…
- Produire les performance reviews hebdomadaire et mensuelle / une review Topline par mois (CA vs obj, couverts, TM), une analyse précise TM par mois (avec taux de prise, prix moyen par catégorie et ajustement offre), une review mensuelle de la marge brute (CA - achats), une analyse mensuelle F&B et People cost théorique vs réel vs marge brute (valeur)
Rendre autonome les directeurs de restaurants et les équipes Siège sur l’obtention et l’analyse de la donnée. / Formations régulières des équipes, procédures écrites pour les nouveaux arrivants, créer des reporting sur mesure sur PowerBI
Assurer une hotline utilisateurs / répondre aux questions

Améliorer la prévisibilité

Suivre des plans d’action de performance opérationnelle / updater les hypothèses et mesurer l’impact des actions validées pour le CODIR
Prévoir le chiffre d’affaires et la marge dans un niveau de granularité fine sur la base de l’historique / Produire le Budget, les reforecasts et le BP
Prévoir les impacts d’un changement de paradigme / Analyses ponctuels sur la base de changements d’hypothèses

Profil recherché
Diplôme : Ecole d’ingénieur ou grandes Ecoles de commerce avec de fortes compétences SI
Background 3ans d’expérience en audit, ultra geek
Maitrise SI exigée : Power BI, Excel, comprendre et gérer le data set

Description
La Direction des Investissements d’Axa France a en charge la gestion, le suivi et la prévision du résultat des actifs financiers d’Axa France. L’équipe Production et Administration des Données est responsable de la mise à disposition des données d’actifs pour toutes la Direction des Investissement et le Risk Management., assure un support auprès des différentes équipes, et développe des outils d’extraction des données, de projection, d’analyse et de reporting pour la Direction des Investissements.
Principales missions:
- Collecter, fiabiliser et diffuser les données utilisées par nos clients. Maintenir et améliorer le processus d’alimentation des bases de données de la Direction des Investissement sous Access
- Assurer la coordination avec les équipes clientes (DI, Risk Management…) et les équipes fournisseurs de données (Compta, Immobilier, Dérivés…)
- Développement de nouveaux outils (Excel, VBA) en réponse à des besoins exprimés par nos clients
- Documentation des développements et process
- Participation au maintien de l’outil de projection des actifs financiers
Qualifications
De formation diplôme d'ingénieur ou master universitaire Bac+5, junior avec stage ou expérience sous Access / Excel
Compétences techniques :
-Compétences nécessaires Access, Excel, VBA

Compétences relationnelles :
Le titulaire du poste doit savoir être à l’écoute et avoir un sens critique vis à vis des demandes et besoins qui lui sont exprimés.
Il doit être force de proposition tant dans l’amélioration des process que dans l’aide apportée à nos clients.
La curiosité, l’autonomie, l’organisation et la facilité de communication sont autant de qualités utiles pour ce poste.
A propos d'AXA
Aimeriez-vous vous lever chaque jour motivé(e) par une mission inspirante et travailler en équipe pour permettre de protéger les personnes et leurs proches?
Chez AXA nous avons l’ambition de mener la transformation de notre métier. Nous cherchons des personnes talentueuses ayant une expérience diversifiée, qui pensent différemment, et qui veulent faire partie de cette transformation passionnante en challengeant le statu quo et faire d’AXA – marque globale leader et une des sociétés les plus innovantes dans notre secteur – une entreprise encore plus performante et responsable.
Dans un monde en perpétuelle évolution et avec une présence dans 64 pays, nos 165 000 salariés et distributeurs privilégiés anticipent le changement pour offrir des services et solutions adaptés aux besoins actuels et futurs de nos 107 millions de clients.
Leader mondial de l’assurance et de la gestion d’actifs, AXA aide ses 100 millions de clients à traverser les petites et grandes difficultés de la vie et les accompagne dans la sécurisation de leurs projets. Pour aider ses collaborateurs dans leur mission, AXA se donne comme priorité de prendre soin d’eux. Ainsi, en rejoignant AXA France vous travaillerez dans une entreprise responsable, offrant une véritable culture d’expertise, accélérant le développement des compétences de chacun, proposant une rémunération attractive et une évolution régulière. Pour vous, nous réinventons notre métier.
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Nos différences sont nos atouts. Chez AXA en France, ce sont plus de 76 nationalités qui travaillent ensemble, sur des métiers divers et variés. Et c’est ce qui fait notre force ! C’est pourquoi nous cherchons à promouvoir l’égalité et la diversité à tous les niveaux (mixité, handicap, initiatives pour favoriser l’insertion des jeunes, orientation sexuelle etc.…)
Afin d’aider les collaborateurs à concilier leur vie professionnelle et personnelle, nous mettons à leur disposition des congés avantageux à toute étape de de leur vie, le temps partiel, des environnements de travail agile, le télétravail, etc.
L’accompagnement et la protection des uns et des autres est notre quotidien. Cette responsabilité, nous la portons au-delà de notre métier depuis 1991 avec l’association AXA Atout Cœur qui œuvre quotidiennement en faveur des causes sociétales et humanitaires dans les domaines de l'exclusion, de la prévention des risques et de la protection de l'environnement. Les collaborateurs d'AXA peuvent ainsi s’investir, s’ils le souhaitent, dans des activités solidaires sur leur temps de travail ou non. Cet engagement bénévole des collaborateurs d’AXA est l’extension des valeurs auxquelles ils croient au quotidien. C’est l’expression de notre culture d’entreprise.
Victime ou témoin, en cas de discrimination, vous pouvez adresser vos signalements et/ou alertes discrimination à : service.discriminations@axa.fr

As a Financial Analyst reporting to the Senior Financial Analyst you will be in charge of:
Developing and improving existing analysis to monitor the company's performance (new ideas are welcome)
Participating to the monthly reporting (P&L reviews, KPI tracking..)
Implementing and maintaining new processes (cost monitoring..)
Aggregating various sources of data while maintaining data integrity and accuracy


You will also:
Assist the Senior Financial Analyst for various tasks: sales forecasting, business planning, financing, M&A...
Requirements
You are pursuing an advanced degree in business, economics and/or finance from one of the top-tier business schools
You have an eye for detail while keeping in mind the big picture
You are highly analytical and driven
You are proficient in English & French
You enjoy working on Excel
Ideally, you are looking for an apprenticeship or "alternance" or a long-term internship (a minimum of 6 months) and already have a first long-term internship under your belt
Start of the intership/apprenticeship : September 2019
Joining our team means:
Working in a stimulating and dynamic environment with great challenges every day and a real opportunity to witness the impact of your work on Famoco’s development
Take part in a real human adventure with passionate, talented colleagues
The unique opportunity to work on state of the art technology with multiple applications across countless markets and customers
The possibility to reveal your skills, enhance them and fulfill yourself greatly
Be among a multicultural community always in search of new ways to enhance each individual’s potential
Working in a beautiful place in the center of Paris

If you want to join a fun team and learn to work in an international start-up company facing an extremely rapid growth, send us your application!

Job description
Founded in 2013, iBanFirst provides businesses with an international optimised financial services platform, combining technological, financial and regulatory expertise. Since its inception, iBanFirst has raised 25 million euros to become the European leader in financial services to companies with global business operations.
Licensed by the National Bank of Belgium, iBanFirst is the only online service that creates personalised IBANs in 25 currencies.
Since its creation, iBanFirst has convinced 2,500 customers for whom the company has processed 100,000 transactions, for a total volume of just under 5 billion euros. Today, the company has offices in Paris, Brussels, Dijon and Antwerp and has 90 employees.
Having already won several awards, iBanFirst has just been chosen as "Fintech scale-up" of the year 2018 in Belgium and is part of Deloitte's recognised "Technology Fast 50.
Fast-growing and groundbreaking, we are expanding in Europe and internationally. Our offices are in Paris, Dijon, Brussels and Antwerp.
Why work for us?
Being part of our team is a unique opportunity to develop your skills and progress rapidly in an environment at the cutting edge of innovation.
What we offer
Various missions and projects in an innovative and rising start-up in a thriving industry (fintech)
A key role and a unique opportunity to shape the future of iBanFirst
A great, professional and international team with a flat hierarchy
A nice work environment, in a brand new office located in Paris 8
Regular offsite and internal events
Attractive package, depending on profile
Preferred experience
What you will do
We seek an experienced, passionate, and highly motivated Business Analyst to join the ‘BI & Business Analytics’ team; you will be part of the Product department which has close interactions with all teams (Sales, Finance, Engineers, Marketing…)
Interns and or professionals are considered for this role.
Your responsibilities will include:
Specifications: gather internal needs in term of reporting and dashboards, create key Dashboards and reports
Analysis & Reporting: build and send regular reports internally, provide recommendations and insights, perform Ad-hoc analysis
Manage a dashboards’ roadmap
Ensure Data integrity and provide support on created Dashboards,
Skills we are looking for
Must have requirements should you be an intern :
You graduated from a top-tier engineering school, business school, or university
You are a fluent English and French speaker
• You have • Effective analytical and organizational skills
Must have requirements should you be a professional :
A minimum of 2-3 years related experience in an analytics role,
Effective analytical and organizational skills,
Strong communication skills this position requires significant amount of cross-department interaction,
Eagerness to work in a rapidly changing team environment,
Nice to have
Prior product management experience
Experience in a fintech or B2B SaaS company

1. Expertise en Data Management
Développer / maintenir une connaissance approfondie et transversale des familles de données (définitions, modélisation des instruments financiers en base, spécificités des fournisseurs de données, règles métier etc);
Développer une connaissance approfondie et transversale des modèles de données implémentés au sein du département, et des applications (fonctionnalités, contrôles etc);

2. Analyse et contrôle de la qualité
Développer des méthodes d’analyse et de remédiations massives de la qualité de la donnée;
Exploiter les indicateurs de qualité existant, et en créer de nouveaux le cas échéant;
O pérer les contrôles qualité définis dans les règles et process interne;
Effectuer un suivi et un contrôle de second niveau des activités de contrôle effectuées par les équipes Data Management Offshore : création et suivi des KPI, participation aux gouvernances opérationnelles.
Suivre les flux fournisseurs en collaboration avec les équipes techniques / IT, et communiquer sur de potentiels problèmes de qualité, de délais de livraison des données;
S’assurer que les données du référentiel respectent les standards définis.
3. Support aux clients
Répondre de façon réactive, efficace et détaillée aux demandes de support des clients (demandes d’information, de vérification, d’extractions etc)
Assurer, en collaboration avec les autres membres de l’équipe, la continuité du service selon les horaires définis par le manager et selon les besoins des clients
Assurer la livraison des rapports ad hoc (closing reports, Reports règlementaires ;cut-off reports etc) selon le format convenu et les délais impartis
Assurer les formations aux nouveaux collaborateurs le cas échéant
4. Data Gouvernance
Suivi des relations avec les fournisseurs en collaboration avec l’équipe Achats et Juridique (qualité des services, coûts, nouvelles offres disponibles)
Suivi et respect des gouvernances Clients en place.
5. Efficacité opérationnelle
Rationnaliser les conrôles existants et identifier les nouveaux contrôles à mettre en place;
Définir, proposer et mettre en place de nouveaux contrôles pour équipes Onshore et Offshore (Inde);
Contribuer au suivi des activités Offshore dans un but d’amélioration permanent des pocessus de Production;

6. Documentation
Maintenir à jour la documentation (Data glossary, documentation de processus, Service Level Agreement avec les clients et/ou les fournisseurs de données);
Assurer le compte-rendu des gouvernances dédiées (Support, Projets, clients..);
Qualifications
Issu(e) d'une formation de type bac+5 (Université / école de commerce), vous disposez d'une première expérience significative au sein d'un établissement financier, en gestion de données financières (Gestion d'actifs).
Vous disposez d'une bonne connaissance des instruments financiers (modélisation, fonctionnement...).

Vous faites preuve de bonnes capacités de communication, en Français comme en anglais, avec nos interlocuteurs internes et externe.

Vous disposez également de compétences avancées sur Excel, SQL et les outils de Meta Data Management

Votre Anglais est courant.

Descposte:
- Finance / Data Management Business Analyst (F/H) - PARIS (180004JI)
Job Description
Finance / Data Management Business Analyst (F/H) - PARIS ( 180004JI )
Primary Location
: FRANCE-75-PARIS-PARIS
Organization
: GIE AXA
Contract Type
: Regular
Shift
: Day Job
Schedule
: Full-time
Description
The business analyst will be part of the Data Management team within PBRC – Financial Controlling. This is a newly-created position, following the decision to internalize within PBRC the team which was previously hosted by AXA GS.

PBRC is the department dedicated to analyzing, commenting and reporting the financial information that is delivered to Group Management and to external parties (mostly shareholders, analysts, auditors and supervisors).

Within PBRC, the Financial Controlling team is the owner of all major Finance processes at Group level and responsible for the production, the analysis and the monitoring of IFRS actual accounts, budget, forecast reporting analyses and the Group annual report and Solvency II Pillar 3 reporting.

The Data Management team will be in charge of managing the financial data collected by PBRC and to administrate the reporting tools used to prepare consolidated financial analyses and reports to the Management.

Key Accountabilities:

Management reports:
Prepare the restitution packs used for clearance meetings and Management reports
Ensure the proper implementation of data base enhancements / new report developments
Provide support users (entities, group team)
Access Management:
Manage the accesses of all IT repositories used by PBRC (SharePoint, Magnitude..)
Data quality:
Ensure the data quality of deliverables.
Enhance controls to improve data quality
Document the set up / review of any Management dashboard
Project:
Participate in the ad-hoc projects (i.e. IFRS17 ,IFRS9)


Qualifications
Graduated from a financial degree or engineering / IT School, you have at least 3 years experience in IT/Finance, ideally in a consulting firm, your main skills are the following:

- Strong IT expertise
- Knowledge of financial concepts & KPIs
- Appetite for the Insurance business
- Rigor, organization, anticipation and flexibility
- Ability to project mode
- Fluent in English
- Good communication skills

Technical Skills:
MS Excel – PivotTables, Functions
Programming: SQL is a plus
Applications: Magnitude is a plus

About AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.
In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 165,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 107 million customers.
What We Offer

Mirakl is a fast growing technology company offering online retailers, B2B distributors and media publishers a solution to drive more sales with more products at higher margins with no inventory investments: the Mirakl Marketplace Platform ©.
Our customers are the leading retailers in France, such as Darty, Game, Go Sport, Galeries Lafayette etc… with some of the largest companies worldwide, such as Walmart, Harvey Nichols, HP etc. Created 5 years ago, Mirakl has all the advantages of a start-up: flexibility in your work, still new markets to penetrate, strategic discussions and challenging projects.

We are seeking a highly motivated, dynamic and data-oriented profile to help us with sales operations activities deployed by Mirakl, starting in Juillet 2019.
60% of the internship will consist in analytical reporting and activities, 40% will consist in sales support. The Marketing Team works closely with the Sales Team to create opportunities and drive prospection. You will therefore take part in several marketing and sales activities (benchmarking, reporting, support for prospect calls, etc.). This exciting opportunity includes developing a strong experience in Marketing and Sales in a growing, international company.

Main Missions:
Market research & Business reporting
Conduct market research, analysis, and segmentation for existing and new markets
Drive lead research to improve overall CRM database and quality of the data
Deliver efficient reportings to support key business processes (including sales and marketing activity)

Business processes & Internal Support
